intro: Diaphananthe paucifolia, commonly known as the few-leaved diaphananthe, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, simple leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and less-studied species in botanical research.
